question_details.query: What is the most cost-effective method for controlling sea lice on Atlantic salmon farms?

summary_details.relevant_summary: Evidence related to sea lice control on Atlantic salmon farms includes: In Ireland, cleaner wrasse showed mixed results; one controlled study found corkwing and goldsinny cleaner wrasse were as effective as chemical treatments at controlling lice, while another replicated, controlled study found rockcook cleaner wrasse were ineffective at preventing lice outbreaks (ID: 738). In Scotland, a study recorded lower lice numbers on salmon in cages using a fallowing system; an Australian study on Amoebic Gill Disease mortality found no difference with fallowing (ID: 1026). In Norway, a replicated, controlled study reported lower lice numbers on salmon kept under low-intensity artificial light or natural lighting, with higher artificial light intensity associated with higher lice numbers (ID: 741).
